DataElement.preferredName: Prior Bone Marrow Stem Cell Transplantation Comorbidity Index Weighted Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score applied when assessing comorbidity(ies) associated with hematopoietic cell transplantion (HCT).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Bone Marrow Stem Cell Transplantation Comorbidity Index
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the rating scale for the coexistence of two or more disease prior to treatment in which hematopoietic cell transplantation capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Bone Marrow Stem Cell Transplantation is the transfer of bone marrow stem cells from one organism to another.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to replace diseased or pathologic bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow stem cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: In epidemiology, a rating scale for comorbidity.

Concepts.definition: In epidemiology, a rating scale for comorbidity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplant Comorbidity Index Weighted Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric value measuring the pre-hematopoietic cell transplantation comorbidity index._A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells._The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.:The coexistence of two or more disease processes.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
The coexistence of two or more disease processes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR transplantation trial
